results.name: When dealing cards into 3 piles (Left, Center, Right), the number of cards in the n-th card's pile, if dealing in a pattern L, C, R, C, L, C, R, C, L, C, ... [as any thoughtful six-year-old will try to do when sharing a pile of candy among 3 people].
comment: A008619 and A000027 interleaved; abs(a(n+1) - a(n)) = A059169(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 15 2014
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,1,0,1,0,-1).
formula: a(n) = ceiling(n/4) if n is odd, n/2 if n is even.
program: (MAGMA) m:=90; R<x>:=PowerSeriesRing(Integers(), m); Coefficients(R!( x*(1+x+x^3)/((1+x^2)*(x-1)^2*(1+x)^2) )); // _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 23 2019
